Violation_Type: Failure to submit admissible new evidence
Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA Officer correctly applied s. 113(a) of IRPA in refusing new evidence
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), s. 113(a)
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed persecution due to perceived LTTE ties; submitted letters, complaints, and country condition reports as evidence
Decision_Outcome: PRRA application denied; judicial review dismissed
Court_Ruling: Federal Court dismissed the application for judicial review
Defendant_Behavior: PRRA Officer refused to accept new evidence under s. 113(a)
Grounds_for_Claim: Perceived association with LTTE leading to risk upon return to Sri Lanka
Legal_Standard: Evidence must be new and not reasonably available at time of RPD hearing
Assessment_Factor: Timing and relevance of evidence; credibility of claim
Procedural_Issue: Admissibility of evidence in PRRA process
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's evidence lacked credibility and personal relevance
Evidence_Used: Letters, complaint documents, country conditions reports
Application_Basis: New evidence must arise after RPD decision or not have been reasonably available
Evidence_Assessed: Evidence predated RPD decision or was general in nature
Relief_Sought: Allowance of PRRA application; stay of removal
Governing_Rule: Under IRPA s. 113(a), only new or previously unavailable evidence is admissible
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Evidence was not new and did not relate directly to applicant's personal circumstances
Outcome: PRRA Officerâ€™s decision upheld; application dismissed
Harm_Assessment: No sufficient risk of persecution or harm established upon return
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed refugee status due to perceived LTTE ties but failed to provide credible, new, or personally relevant evidence after RPD rejection
Evidence_Handling: PRRA Officer excluded evidence that was not new or reasonably unavailable
Legal_Provision_Violated: None found; compliance with IRPA s. 113(a) confirmed
Evidence_Issues: Submission of stale and non-personalized evidence
Residency_Compliance: Applicant was in Canada without valid status post-claim rejection
Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over PRRA judicial review
Evidence_Assessment: Officer properly assessed timeliness and relevance of evidence
Decision_Rationale: Evidence did not meet criteria under s. 113(a); no error in officer's application of law
Decision_Making_Body: PRRA Officer, Federal Court of Canada
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to provide new, credible, and personally relevant evidence
Legal_Standard_Applied: Correct legal test under s. 113(a) of IRPA
